Product Title: Red Sky At Morning
Review Date: 2023/01/06
Store: Richard Thomas  (Actor),     Catherine Burns  (Actor),     James Goldstone  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama
Product Description: ["An adolescent boy and his mother are sent to live in New Mexico after his father goes off to fight World War II. The move is hard on both mother and son. The boy, one of the few whites in the area, must deal with making friends, the strange new land, and first love. Meanwhile, his mother becomes increasingly withdrawn. When they learn that his father has been killed, the son must fight with his mother's lover to become the real head of the household."]
Average Rating: 4.2

And Now Tomorrow
Alan Ladd, Loretta Young, Susan Hayward  (Actor),     Irving Pichel  (Director)    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure
["Alan Ladd, Loretta Young and Susan Hayward star in this powerful love story And Now Tomorrow about one woman's extraordinary struggle over adversity. Emily Blair (Young) seems to have it all: money, prestige and independence. However, when her sense of hearing fades, her only hope lies with the young and determined Dr. Marek Vance (Ladd). As they search for a cure to her condition, hope gives way to unexpected romance in this screenplay co-written by famed detective novelist Raymond Chandler and featuring stunning costumes by Edith Head."]

['Product Description', 'I SAW THE LIGHT is the story of the legendary country western singer Hank Williams (Tom Hiddleston), who in his brief life created one of the greatest bodies of work in American music. Sweet Dreams (DVD)
Ed Harris  (Actor),     Jessica Lange  (Actor),     Karel Reisz  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, HBO, All HBO Titles
['Sweet Dreams (DVD)', 'She was the first female solo artist to be elected to the Country Music Hall of Fame. Thirty-two years after her untimely death in a plane crash in Tennessee, Patsy Cline\'s "Greatest Hits" album sold over six million copies. Loved by her fans today as much - if not more-than she was at the height of her fame, the life, the loves and most of all the voice of Patsy Cline is legendary. SWEET DREAMS tells her story. Marrying the unique singing voice of Patsy Cline, with a powerhouse performance by Jessica Lange, director Karel Reisz creates an extraordinary portrait of the passionate, fun-loving, soft-spoken, loud-living life and times of one of country\'s - and one of popular music\'s greatest singing stars. Covering the years 1956through 1963, from her rise to fame and the top of the charts through TV talent shows and country bars; through her turbulent marriage to Charlie Dick and the demands of touring which would lead to the fatal plane crash, this remarkable story is one that will be treasured by fans old and new. A celebration of the talent we love, and the story of Patsy Cline.', ']]>']

Scandal At Scourie (1953)
Greer Garson  (Actor),     Walter Pidgeon  (Actor),     Jean Negulesco  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
["Legendary Hollywood screen pair Greer Garson and Walter Pidgeon team for the ninth and last time in Scandal at Scourie, a heart-tugging Technicolor drama that has the duo facing obstacles with the kind of unbreakable love that saw them through aerial bombardments in Mrs. Miniver or the challenges of the medical unknown in Madame Curie. Set in Ontario, Canada, the story centers on Victoria and Patrick McChesney, whose decision to adopt an orphaned Catholic girl ignites controversy in their Protestant community. Patrick is accused of using the adoption to appeal to Catholic voeters and advance his political career. Victoria contends with self-righteous whispers about the child's out-of-wedlock birth. And an event in the child's past leads to a fear-mongering change that she is a pyromaniac. Passions and accusations rage. But like a ship plying stormy seas, the McChesney' love for each other and their child will prevail."]

A good movie with lots of empathy and comfort for the little girl who had been orphaned and in search of a family/  Greer Garson was terrific in this.  Walter Pidgeon was so good, also. My favorite kind of movie, probably because I felt lost and alone most of my childhood due to unkindness in a foster home.  Grew to get to know God as Father, which saved me. Finding out how much He loved me made the greatest difference in my life.
People sacrificing to show the love of God.

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary**

- **Media Preferences**: The user remains focused on films that explore serious themes of personal growth, warmth, and emotional depth, with a strong affinity for narratives that emphasize empathy and family connections.

- **Rating Tendencies**: Recent experiences have sharpened the user's critical lens, as exemplified by a recent 2-star rating attributed to disapproval of content and language, diverging from previous more positive ratings. They continue to appreciate films that resonate with their experiences.

- **Emotional Engagement**: A deep connection to character arcs and emotional storytelling persists, with the user seeking authentic depictions of human experiences that provide comfort and relatability.

- **Educational Value**: There is a consistent interest in films tackling social issues and offering emotional insights, reiterated by their pursuit of narratives that support personal growth and spiritual exploration.

- **Subject Matter Interest**: The user consistently favors biographical and community-centric stories that highlight themes of resilience and sacrifice, signaling a preference for genuine representation.

- **Constructive Critique**: Their feedback balances critique and appreciation, driven by a desire for impactful cinema that fosters emotional connection and educational insights while upholding authenticity in storytelling. Recent ratings suggest a heightened sensitivity to content appropriateness, especially concerning younger audiences.
